member.name: T:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI
member.summary: Provides API for interfacing with the main game. It is useful mostly in the actual game, but some functions will work outside of it (for example in FreeH).

member.name: E:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.StartH
member.summary: Fired after an H scene is loaded. Can be both in the main game and in free h. Runs immediately after all objects trigger their events.

member.name: E:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.EndH
member.summary: Fired after an H scene is ended, but before it is unloaded. Can be both in the main game and in free h. Runs immediately after all objects trigger their events.

member.name: E:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.GameLoad
member.summary: Fired right after a game save is succesfully loaded. Runs immediately after all objects trigger their events.

member.name: E:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.GameSave
member.summary: Fired right before the game state is saved to file. Runs immediately after all objects trigger their events.

member.name: P:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.InsideHScene
member.summary: True if any sort of H scene is currently loaded.

member.name: M:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.GetBehaviours
member.summary: Get all registered behaviours for the game.

member.name: M:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.GetRegisteredBehaviour(System.String)
member.summary: Get the first controller that was registered with the specified extendedDataId.

member.name: M:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.GetRegisteredBehaviour(System.Type)
member.summary: Get the first controller of the specified type that was registered. The type has to be an exact match.

member.name: M:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.GetRegisteredBehaviour(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Get the first controller of the specified type that was registered with the specified extendedDataId. The type has to be an exact match.

member.name: M:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.RegisterExtraBehaviour``1(System.String)
member.summary: Register new functionality that will be added to main game. Offers easy API for custom main game logic. All you have to do is create a type that inherits from > (don't make instances, the API will make them for you). Warning: The custom controller is immediately created when it's registered, but its OnGameLoad method is not called until a game actually loads. This might mean that if the registration happens too late you will potentially miss some load events.
member.typeparam: Type with your custom logic to add to a character
member.param: Extended data ID used by this behaviour. Set to null if not used.

member.name: M:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.AddActionIcon(System.Int32,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Sprite,UnityEngine.Sprite,System.Action,System.Action{Illusion.Component.TriggerEnterExitEvent})
member.summary: Register a new action icon in roaming mode (like the icons for training/studying, club report screen, peeping). Icon templates can be found here https://github.com/IllusionMods/IllusionModdingAPI/tree/master/src/KKAPI/MainGame/ActionIcons
member.param: Identification number of the map the icon should be spawned on
Position of the icon. All default icons are spawned at y=0, but different heights work fine to a degree. You can figure out the position by walking to it and getting the player position with RUE.
Icon shown when player is in range to click it (excited state).
Icon shown when player is out of range.
Action triggered when player clicks the icon (If you want to open your own menu, use to enable mouse cursor and hide the action icon to prevent it from being clicked again.).
Optional action to run after the icon is created. Use to attach extra code to the icon, e.g. by using and similar methods.

member.name: M:KKAPI.MainGame.GameAPI.AddTouchIcon(UnityEngine.Sprite,System.Action{UnityEngine.UI.Button},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Register a new touch icon in talk scenes in roaming mode (like the touch and look buttons on top right when talking to a character). Icon templates can be found here https://github.com/IllusionMods/IllusionModdingAPI/tree/master/src/KKAPI/MainGame/TouchIcons By default this functions as a simple button. If you want to turn this into a toggle you have to manually switch button.image.sprite as needed.
member.param: Icon shown by default
Action to run after the icon is created. Use to subscribe to the onClick event and/or attach extra code to the button, e.g. by using and similar methods.
Row of the button, counted from top at 0. Buttons are added from right to left. Row has to be between 0 and 5, but 0 to 2 are recommended.
Order of the buttons in a row. Lower value is placed more to the right. By default order of adding the icons is used.

member.name: T:KKAPI.MainGame.GameCustomFunctionController
member.summary:
Base type for custom game extensions. It provides many useful methods that abstract away the nasty hooks needed to figure out when the state of the game changes.
This controller is a MonoBehaviour that is created upon registration in . The controller is created only once. If it's created too late it might miss some events. It's recommended to register controllers in your Start method.

member.param: Your custom data to be written to the character card. Can be null to remove the data.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.RegisterCustomSubCategories
member.summary: This event is fired every time the character maker is being loaded, near the very beginning. This is the only chance to add custom sub categories. Custom controls can be added now on later in . Warning: All custom subcategories and custom controls are cleared on maker exit and need to be re-added on next maker start. It's recommended to completely clear your GUI state in in preparation for loading into maker again.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.MakerStartedLoading
member.summary: Early in the process of maker loading. Most game components are initialized and had their Start methods ran. Warning: Some components and objects might not be loaded or initialized yet, especially if they are mods. Warning: All custom subcategories and custom controls are cleared on maker exit and need to be re-added on next maker start.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.MakerBaseLoaded
member.summary: Maker is fully loaded. Use to load mods that rely on something that is loaded late, else use MakerStartedLoading. This is the last chance to add custom controls! Warning: All custom subcategories and custom controls are cleared on maker exit and need to be re-added on next maker start.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.MakerFinishedLoading
member.summary: Maker is fully loaded and the user has control. Warning: Avoid loading mods or doing anything heavy in this event.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.MakerExiting
member.summary: Fired after the user exits the maker. Use this to clean up any references and resources. You want to return to the state you were in before maker was loaded.

member.name: P:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.CharaListIsLoading
member.summary: Use to avoid unnecessary processing cards when they are loaded to the character list. For example, don't load extended data for these characters since it's never used.

member.summary: Check if a plugin is loaded and has at least the minimum version. If the plugin is missing or older than minimumVersion, user is shown an error message on screen and false is returned. Warning: Run only from Start, not from constructor or Awake because some plugins might not be loaded yet!
member.param: Your plugin
Guid of the plugin your plugin is dependant on
Minimum version of the required plugin
Level of the issue - Error if plugin can't work, Warning if there might be issues, or None to not show any message.
member.returns: True if plugin exists and it's version equals or is newer than minimumVersion, otherwise false

Guid of the plugin your plugin is incompatible with
Level of the issue - Error if plugin can't work, Warning if there might be issues, or None to not show any message.
member.returns: True if plugin exists, otherwise false

member.name: T:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController
member.summary:
Base type for custom character extensions. It provides many useful methods that abstract away the nasty hooks needed to figure out when a character is changed or how to save and load your custom data to the character card.
This controller is a MonoBehaviour that is added to root gameObjects of ALL characters spawned into the game. It's recommended to not use constructors, Awake or Start in controllers. Use instead.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.OnReload(KKAPI.GameMode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: OnReload is fired whenever the character's state needs to be updated. This might be beacuse the character was just loaded into the game, was replaced with a different character, etc. Use this method instead of Awake and Start. It will always get called before other methods, but after the character is in a usable state. WARNING: Make sure to completely reset your state in this method! Assume that all of your variables are no longer valid!
member.param: Game mode we are currently in
If true, the current state should be preserved. Do not load new extended data, instead reuse what you currently have or do nothing.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.OnReload(KKAPI.GameMode)

member.name: T:KKAPI.Utilities.ConfigurationManagerAttributes
member.summary:
Class that specifies how a setting should be displayed inside the ConfigurationManager settings window.
Usage: You can use this copy of the class instead of including it in your own plugin. Make a new instance, assign any fields that you want to override, and pass it as a tag for your setting.
If a field is null (default), it will be ignored and won't change how the setting is displayed. If a field is non-null (you assigned a value to it), it will override default behavior.
member.remarks: You can read more and see examples in the readme at https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx.ConfigurationManager You can optionally remove fields that you won't use from this class, it's the same as leaving them null.

member.name: F:KKAPI.Utilities.ConfigurationManagerAttributes.ShowRangeAsPercent
member.summary: Should the setting be shown as a percentage (only use with value range settings).

member.name: T:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils
member.summary: Utility methods for working with coroutines.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.AppendCo(System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls the appendCoroutine after baseCoroutine finishes

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.AppendCo(System.Collections.IEnumerator,UnityEngine.YieldInstruction)
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls the yieldInstruction after baseCoroutine finishes. Useless on its own, append further coroutines to run after this.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.AppendCo(System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Action[])
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls each of the actions in order after base coroutine finishes. One action is called per frame. First action is called right after the coroutine finishes.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.CreateCoroutine(System.Action[])
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls each of the action delegates on consecutive frames. One action is called per frame. First action is called right away. There is no frame skip after the last action.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.CreateCoroutine(UnityEngine.YieldInstruction,System.Action[])
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls each of the action delegates on consecutive frames. One action is called per frame. First action is called right after the yieldInstruction. There is no frame skip after the last action.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.ComposeCoroutine(System.Collections.IEnumerator[])
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls each of the supplied coroutines in order.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.AttachToYield(System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Action)
member.summary: Create a coroutine that is the same as the supplied coroutine, except every time it yields the onYieldAction is invoked. (i.e. onYieldAction is invoked after every yield return in the original coroutine) If the coroutine returns another coroutine, the action is not called for yields performed by the returned coroutine, only the topmost one. Use FlattenCo if that's an issue.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.FlattenCo(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Flatten the coroutine to yield all values directly. Any coroutines yield returned by this coroutine will have their values directly returned by this new coroutine (this is recursive). For example if another coroutine is yielded by this coroutine, the yielded coroutine will not be returned and instead the values that it yields will be returned. If a yielded coroutine yields yet another coroutine, that second coroutine's values will be returned directly from the flattened coroutine.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.StripYields(System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove yields from the coroutine, making its code run immediately.
member.param: Coroutine to strip
Should only yield return null be stripped? If false, all yields are stripped

Should the coroutine be flattened before stripping it? If this is false then yields from coroutines returned by this coroutine will not be stripped. If this and onlyStripNulls are both false, coroutines returned by this coroutine will not be executed.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.RunImmediately(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Fully executes the coroutine synchronously (immediately run all of its code till completion).

member.name: F:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.WaitForEndOfFrame
member.summary: Cached WaitForEndOfFrame. Use instead of creating a new instance every time to reduce garbage production.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.ResourceUtils.GetEmbeddedResource(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Get a file set as "Embedded Resource" from the assembly that is calling this code, or optionally from a specified assembly. The filename is matched to the end of the resource path, no need to give the full path. If 0 or more than 1 resources match the provided filename, an exception is thrown. For example if you have a file "ProjectRoot\Resources\icon.png" set as "Embedded Resource", you can use this to load it by doing GetEmbeddedResource("icon.png"), assuming that no other embedded files have the same name.
member.exception: Thrown if none or more than one resources were found matching the given resourceFileName

member.summary: Show windows file open dialog. Blocks the thread until user closes the dialog. Returns list of selected files, or null if user cancelled the action.
member.param: A string to be placed in the title bar of the dialog box. If this member is NULL, the system uses the default title (that is, Save As or Open)
The initial directory. The algorithm for selecting the initial directory varies on different platforms.
A list of filter pairs separated by |. First item is the display name, while the second is the actual filter (e.g. *.txt) Example: "Log files (.log)|*.log|All files|*.*"
The default extension. This extension is appended to the file name if the user fails to type an extension.
A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box. When the dialog box returns, it sets these flags to indicate the user's input. This member can be a combination of the CommomDialgueFlags.
Hwnd pointer of the owner window. IntPtr.Zero to use default parent
Filename that is initially entered in the filename box.

member.name: T:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.SceneCustomFunctionController
member.summary:
Base type for custom scene/studio extensions. It provides many useful methods that abstract away the nasty hooks needed to figure out when a scene is loaded or imported, or how to save and load your custom data to the scene file.
This controller is a MonoBehaviour that is created upon registration in . The controller is created only once. If it's created too late it might miss some scene load events. It's recommended to register controllers in your Start method.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.SceneCustomFunctionController.OnSceneLoad(KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.SceneOperationKind,KKAPI.Utilities.ReadOnlyDictionary{System.Int32,Studio.ObjectCtrlInfo})
member.summary: Fired when a scene is successfully changed, either by loading, importing or resetting.
member.param: Operation that caused this event

A dictionary of items loaded by this operation and their original IDs. The IDs are identical to the IDs at the time of saving the scene, even during import. Warning: The IDs here might not be the same as IDs of the objects in the scene! To get current scene ID of the object call

member.summary: Fired when a scene is about to be saved and any exteneded data needs to be written.

member.name: T:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.StudioSaveLoadApi
member.summary: Provides API for loading and saving scenes, as well as a convenient way for registering custom studio functions.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.StudioSaveLoadApi.RegisterExtraBehaviour``1(System.String)
member.summary: Register new functionality that will be added to studio. Offers easy API for saving and loading extended data. All necessary hooking and event subscribing is done for you. Importing scenes is also handled for you. All you have to do is create a type that inherits from > (don't make instances, the API will make them for you). Warning: The custom controller is immediately created when it's registered, but its OnSceneLoad method is not called until a scene actually loads. This might mean that if the registration happens too late you will potentially miss some load events.
member.typeparam: Type with your custom logic to add to a character
member.param: Extended data ID used by this behaviour. Set to null if not used.

member.summary: Fired right before a scene is saved to file. Runs immediately after all objects trigger their events.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.StudioSaveLoadApi.Hooks.ObjectInfoLoadTranspiler(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{HarmonyLib.CodeInstruction})
member.summary: The original code reads the dicKey of an object on import and does nothing with it. Capture that variable and use it to construct an import dictionary. GetNewIndex is called before this and will be used to get the dicKey used in the scene.

member.name: T:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage
member.summary: A class for storing textures that should be saved and loaded from extended data's (e.g. to character cards and scenes). Duplicate textures are automatically handled so that only one copy of the texture is held in memory and saved.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.#ctor(UnityEngine.TextureFormat)
member.summary: Create a new TextureStorage.
member.param: Format of the loaded textures. It doesn't affect data saved to extended data.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.PurgeUnused(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Remove unused textures based on a list of used IDs. Textures with IDs not in the list will be removed.
member.param: A list of IDs to be kept if they exist

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.GetAllTextureIDs
member.summary: Get IDs of all textures stored in this object.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.Clear(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clear the texture list and optionally destroy all textures.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.Load(ExtensibleSaveFormat.PluginData)
member.summary: Load textures from extended data that were stored with .

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.Save(ExtensibleSaveFormat.PluginData)
member.summary: Save textures stored in this object to extended data. Can be loaded later with .

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.StoreTexture(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Store a texture and get an ID representing it. The ID can be used to get the texture with . If you try to store a texture that was already stored before, the ID of the previous texture is returned so there are no multiple identical textures stored.
member.param: Raw PNG data of the texture. If you reuse a texture make sure you always use the same PNG data or deduplicating won't work.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.GetSharedTexture(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a texture based on texture ID. The same texture is returned every time, so it shouldn't be destroyed.
member.param: ID of the texture you want to get. You get the ID when using .
